translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fifth Section
The Discussion of the Mind as Object

analyzed: cetas upariyāye ñāṇam citta ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: Is knowledge of penetration of minds only the mind as object, not another’s object?
“Yes.”

original: Nanu atthi koci sarāgaṁ cittaṁ “sarāgaṁ cittan”ti pajānātīti?
analyzed: nanu atthi koci sa rāgam cittam sa rāgam cittam iti pajānāti iti
translated: “Isn’t there someone who discerns a mind with passion as ‘a mind with passion’?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi koci sarāgaṁ cittaṁ “sarāgaṁ cittan”ti pajānāti, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi koci sa rāgam cittam sa rāgam cittam ti pajānāti no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Then it is not right to say that knowledge of penetration of minds is only the mind as object, not another’s object.”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns a mind without passion as ‘a mind without passion’?”

original: “cetopariyāye ñāṇaṁ cittārammaṇaññeva na aññārammaṇan”ti.🔽Nanu atthi koci vītarāgaṁ cittaṁ …pe…🔽sadosaṁ cittaṁ …🔽vītadosaṁ cittaṁ …🔽samohaṁ cittaṁ …
analyzed: cetas upariyāye ñāṇam citta ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti  nanu atthi koci vīta rāgam cittam pe  sa dosam cittam  vīta dosam cittam  sa moham cittam
translated: “Isn’t there someone who discerns a mind with aversion as ‘a mind with aversion’?”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns a mind without aversion as ‘a mind without aversion’?”

analyzed: vīta moham cittam  saṅkhittam cittam  vikkhittam cittam
translated: “Isn’t there someone who discerns a mind with delusion as ‘a mind with delusion’?”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns a mind without delusion as ‘a mind without delusion’?”
“Isn’t there someone who discerns a contracted mind as ‘a contracted mind’?”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns a distracted mind as ‘a distracted mind’?”

analyzed: sauttaram cittam  anuttaram cittam  samāhitam cittam
translated: “Isn’t there someone who discerns an exalted mind as ‘an exalted mind’?”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns an unexalted mind as ‘an unexalted mind’?”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns a surpassed mind as ‘a surpassed mind’?”
“Isn’t there someone who discerns an unsurpassed mind as ‘an unsurpassed mind’?”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns a concentrated mind as ‘a concentrated mind’?”

analyzed: a vimuttam cittam a vimuttam cittam iti pajānāti iti 🔽āmantā
translated: “Isn’t there someone who discerns an unconcentrated mind as ‘an unconcentrated mind’?”🔽“Isn’t there someone who discerns a liberated mind as ‘a liberated mind’?”

original: Hañci atthi koci avimuttaṁ cittaṁ “avimuttaṁ cittan”ti pajānāti, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci atthi koci avimuttam cittam avimuttam cittanti pajānāti no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Is there any unliberated mind that is known as ‘unliberated mind’?

original: “cetopariyāye ñāṇaṁ cittārammaṇaññeva na aññārammaṇan”ti.🔽Phassārammaṇe ñāṇaṁ vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: cetas upariyāye ñāṇam citta ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti  phassa ārammaṇe ñāṇam
translated: “Knowledge of penetration of minds is only about the mind and not about anything else.”
“Should knowledge about the object of contact be called ‘knowledge of penetration of minds’?

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci phassārammaṇe ñāṇaṁ vattabbaṁ cetopariyāye ñāṇaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci phassa ārammaṇe ñāṇam vattabbam cetas pariyāye ñāṇa no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.🔽“Should knowledge about the object of contact be called ‘knowledge of penetration of minds’?

analyzed: cetas upariyāye ñāṇam citta ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: “Knowledge of penetration of minds is only about the mind and not about anything else.”
“Should knowledge about the object of feeling …
about the object of perception …🔽about the object of volition …
about the object of consciousness …

analyzed: saddhā ārammaṇe ñāṇam  vīriya ārammaṇe ñāṇam
translated: about the object of faith …🔽about the object of energy …
about the object of mindfulness …
about the object of concentration …

analyzed: paññā ārammaṇe ñāṇam  rāga ārammaṇe ñāṇam  dosa ārammaṇe ñāṇam
translated: about the object of wisdom …🔽about the object of lust …🔽about the object of hatred …
about the object of delusion …
about the object of agitation …
be called ‘knowledge of penetration of minds’?
“Yes.

original: Hañci anottappārammaṇe ñāṇaṁ vattabbaṁ cetopariyāye ñāṇaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci anottappa ārammaṇe ñāṇam vattabbam cetas pariyāye ñāṇa no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “If knowledge of the object of one free from agitation is to be called knowledge of the survey of minds, then it should be said that it is. But it should not be said that it is.🔽

analyzed: cetas upariyāye ñāṇam citta ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: “When it is said, ‘Knowledge of penetration of minds is knowledge with regard to what is not a sign of agitation,’ is it to be said that knowledge of penetration of minds is knowledge with regard to the mind and its range, or is it not?”
“It is not to be said.”
“Is knowledge with regard to the mind and its range knowledge with regard to the sign of contact, or is it not?”
“It is not to be said.”
“Is knowledge with regard to the sign of contact knowledge with regard to the mind and its range, or is it not?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  vedanā ārammaṇe ñāṇam pe
translated: “It is not to be said.”

“Is knowledge with regard to the mind and its range knowledge with regard to the sign of feeling … the sign of perception … the sign of the mental factors … the sign of what is not a sign of agitation, or is it not?”

analyzed: anottappa ārammaṇe ñāṇam na vattabba  ceta upariyāye ñāṇ anti  āmantā
translated: “It is not to be said.”

analyzed: an uttappa pariyāye  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is knowledge with regard to the sign of what is not a sign of agitation knowledge with regard to the mind and its range, or is it not?”
“It is not to be said.”

analyzed: cetas upariyāye ñāṇam citta ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: “Is knowledge with regard to the mind and its range knowledge with regard to the sign of what is not a sign of agitation, or is it not?”
“It is not to be said.”
“Is it not the case that knowledge with regard to the mind and its range is knowledge with regard to the sign of what is not a sign of agitation?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci cetopariyāye ñāṇaṁ, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci cetas upariyāye tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “It is not to be said.”

analyzed: cetas upariyāye ñāṇam citta ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: “When it is said, ‘Knowledge of penetration of minds is knowledge with regard to the sign of what is not a sign of agitation,’ is it to be said that knowledge of penetration of minds is knowledge with regard to the mind and its range, or is it not?”🔽“It is not to be said.”
The Discussion of the Mind-object is finished.
